records.context_note: At 19:10 Lt, of 01st August 2019, the M/N "OPEN ARMS" (NGO) rescued two wooden boat in distress, that amounts to a total of 123 persons. [Text removed-Reporting tools] has requested for the evacuation of some people including an Eritrean male, suspected to be infected of TBC (tubercolousis). [Text removed-Reporting tools], has despatched the [Text removed-Technical Equipment], that has trasferred the man from the M/N OPEN ARMS to [Text removed-Operational Area], where they ariived at 22:50 LT.

On 12 August 2019, at 15h45, [Text removed-Technical equipment], in response to a request from Text removed-Reporting tools to detect and observe a Tunisian fishing vessel which had requested medical assistance, detected one small rubber boat adrift with two persons on board. The boat was detected Text removed-Sensitive Operational Information. Several attempts were made by Text removed-Technical Equipment to establish radio contact with vessels in the vicinity but without success. Text removed-Reporting tools informed Frontex that a helicopter was dispatched to reach and operate in the area. At around 19h30, after a MEDEVAC operation, the helicopter took on board one of the two persons from the rubber boat. The other person was confirmed to be deceased and was left behind in the rubber boat. Text removed-Reporting tools, Text removed-Technical Equipment recovered the dead body. Text removed-Reporting tools have informed that, due to the corpse's high state of decomposition, it was not possible to recover it by helicopter on the previous day.

At 07:35z, [Text Removed - Technical Equipment]spotted an overcrowded rubber boat with about 90 migrants on board [Text Removed - Reporting Tools]. The boat with more than 100 people on board was still close to the Libyan shore (approx. 30 nm) when it was detected. It was taking water at the rear. At 07:49 [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] assessed that this event was a distress situation. Instructed [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] immediately send a call for immediate assistance on [Text Removed - Technical Equipment]. [Text Removed - Reporting Tools], the [Text Removed - Human Resources] decided to ask [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] to specifically contact and direct the NGO vessel to scene. The NGO vessel answered at 07:59z informed the aircraft that they were heading to the SAR area. The [Text Removed Technical Equipment] shadowed the rescue activity until a RHIB from the NGO Vessel approached the migrant rubber boat and distributed life vests to the migrants. At that time the boat was in quite good condition, the sea state was good and the people on board were calm. After duly informing the NGO vessel, [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] was instructed by [Text Removed - Human Resources] to attend two other migrant boats that had not been relocated and were also in a critical situation. At 09:35Z [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] sighted a rigid inflatable boat from Open Arms approaching the migrant boat and distributed some lifejackets. According to the information provided by NGO Vessel Open Arms [Text Removed - Reporting Tools], during the rescue operation the boat structure failed and all passengers fell into the water. Later in the afternoon, NGO OPEN ARMS informed [Text Removed - Reporting Tools] that casualties had been reported during the rescue. At least 5 people had drowned and several severe casualties had been reported. Over 100 persons have been rescued by the NGO vessel. The NGO declared that now they are not able to provide a definitive number of people rescued during this event, but they communicated this information: Approximately 100 to 150 persons were rescued (number to be confirmed); 7 women and 4 kids, 2 of them babies; 1 pregnant woman (7 months) in state of hypothermia; 2 people in critical situation (1 of them a baby); 5 dead bodies (drowned); 1 person recovered by PCR (in need of further medical assistance); Several persons in state of hypothermia. UPDATE: A total of 261 migrants had been rescued and 5 corpses had been recovered in 3 separate incidents by the NGO Vessel Open Arms. Italian and Maltese authorities performed 2 MEDEVAC: [Text Removed - Reporting Tools] [Text Removed - Reporting Tools]. Trapani port was assigned for NGO vessel OPEN ARMS as Port of Safety by the Italian authorities. 14 November 2020, all migrants on board NGO vessel "Open Arms" disembarked at Trapani port [Text Removed - Reporting Tools] where they will remain in quarantine.

On 10.11.2020 at 09:05LT [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] sighted a rubber boat with migrants on booard at 25NM north from Sabratah. On 11.11.2020 at 10:15 LT the rubber boat was intercepted by NGO/Open Arms that recovered on board 105 migrants and 5 corpses. After the rescue operation NGO/Open Arms informed MRCC Rome that 1 baby in critical situation was died. [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] performed a medical evacuation, 1 baby and his mother and 1 male adult were transferred on Lampedusa island and later on Malta hospital by [Text Removed - Technical Equipment]. On 12.11.2020 at 00:34LT [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] performed a second medical evacuation, 1 pregnant woman, the baby's mother and the corpse of the baby, the [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] landed on Lampedusa island at 02:16LT. [Text Removed - Reporting Tools]

records.where_clear: Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR), near 33.3258333333, 12.9061111111
records.context_note: On 13/11/2020, at 08:05Z, Text Removed - Technical Equipment sighted a white rubber boat in distress in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR). The boat was carrying approximately 100 migrants on board and was overcrowded and partially deflated. Some migrants were in the water, hanging on the boat and debris were scattered around. Text Removed - Technical Equipment immediately broadcasted a mayday relay message, calling for assistance. In parallel, Text Removed - Reporting Tools informed the relevant authorities. Text Removed - Technical Equipment, had to leave the area and return to base due to fuel limitation. Finally, Libyan Coast Guard performed the rescue operation that finished at approximately 11:30Z. A total of 102 migrants were rescued and 2 corpses were recovered.
records.evidence_quote: A total of 102 migrants were rescued and 2 corpses were recovered.
